result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel Luis Soto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with 21CM645, 21CM646, 21CM647, 21CM12, 20CM1542, and consecutive to 21CF1734, 21CF436, TIME SERVED
Pay restitution in the amount of $132.00 payable to Kohl's Department Store by 10-01-2022 or convert to civil judgment with tax intercept.

Pay mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, by 12-31-2022. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 
Court waives all non-mandatory costs, fees, surcharges
Fine set at $0.

records.addlTxt: Restitution breakdown, filed
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Gabriel Luis Soto in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Gabriel Luis Soto.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt. 

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties. Additional statements by C.M.

As to Count 1: Defendant ordered to serve 47 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to 21CM645, 21CM646, 21CM647, 21CM12, 20CM1542, and consecutive to 21CF1734, 21CF436, credit of 47 days time served, a time served disposition. 

- Pay mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, by 12-31-2022. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs, fees, surcharges
- Fine set at $0.
- Pay restitution in the amount of $132.00 payable to Kohl's Department Store by 10-01-2022 or convert to civil judgment with tax intercept.
Letter of support for defendant.
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Gabriel Luis Soto in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements made by the State. Case adjourned for a continued sentencing hearing in Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gabriel Luis Soto in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Revocation of Agreement. 

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction. Court orders defendant to remain out of custody until the sentencing hearing.
Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

HELD OFF THE RECORD. Due to court congestion case adjourned for Review Hearing on 8/4/2022 at 4:00.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Support Letter

Defendant Gabriel Luis Soto in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gabriel Luis Soto appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a hearing due to a violation. Court finds that the defendant is not in compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract. Court heard arugments from parties. SANCTION: Court ordered 5 days in jail. Defendant is to report by July 15th, 2022 by 9:00 am to serve a 3 day sanction, with release on Sunday, July 17th, 2022. Defendant is then to serve an additonal 2 day jail sanction with a report date of July 22nd, 2022 by 9:00 pm.

Defendant Gabriel Luis Soto in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court addressed the defendants compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 0 points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

received and filed.
No Contact Order with Kohls Department Store, located at 3737 S. 27th St., Milwaukee, WI
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing Deferred. 

Case to tag along with DTC cases. Case adjourned for Status Conference in branch 21.

Defendant Gabriel Luis Soto in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gabriel Luis Soto appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
